definition[0]: to get rid of something that you do not want or need
example[0]: We usually throw out all our old magazines.
definition[1]: to make someone leave a place, school, or organization, especially because they have done something that is against the rules
example[1]: Nick got thrown out of college in the second year for taking drugs.
example[2]: I knew he would never throw us out on the street (=make us leave our home when we have nowhere else to live).
definition[2]: if people throw out a plan or suggestion, they refuse to accept it
example[3]: The idea was thrown out by the committee.
example[4]: The bill was thrown out by the Senate.
definition[3]: if something throws out smoke, heat, dust etc, it produces a lot of it and fills the air with it
example[5]: huge trucks throwing out noxious fumes from their exhausts
example[6]: They are throwing out their old mainframe computers.
definition[4]: to decide not to accept a plan, suggestion, or legal decision
example[7]: The appeals court threw out the verdict.
